citeinfo.origin: Fisheries and Oceans Canada - Ocean Science And Productivity, Pacific
citeinfo.title: Ship of Opportunity - Canada to Australia, 1981-present

descript.abstract: Data from merchant ships travelling between British Columbia and Australia, from 1981 to 1988 (Lillooet), 1997-1998 (Western Hawk), 1998-1999 (Australian Current), and 1999-2000, continuing (Packing). Data collected include total carbon dioxide, alkalinity(after 1997), nutrients, chlorophyll a (after 1997), carbon-13 in seawater, atmospheric carbon dioxide (PCO2), and atmospheric carbon-13. Underway measurements include position, time, temperature and salinity
descript.purpose: Constructing models of Pacific Ocean carbon cycling; air-sea exchange, monitoring long term changes in the Pacific Ocean, tracking water masses in the ocean, El Nino monitoring
descript.supplinf: Risk Justification: Custodian will be leaving soon and has a large quantity of data not secured in a regional data centre. Risk of Loss: High Impact Justification: Time series of 5 to 10 years Impact of Loss: Medium Recommended Action: Obtain access to data, bring data to archives

place.placekey: South Inner Coast (Johnstone, Georgia, JDF, inlets and passages)
North Inner Coast (QCS, Hecate, Dixon Inlet and passages)

idinfo.useconst: Data will be available after it is quality checked and published.

cntaddr.address: Institute of Ocean Sciences, P.O. Box 6000, 9860 West Saanich Road

dataqual.logic: Interlaboratory comparisons of nutrient and carbon-13 and oxygen-18 measurements; comparison to known standards. Salinometer calibrated with standard seawater. Fluorometer calibrated with commercially prepared standard or concentrated natural pigments.Nutrient standards compared to commercially prepared standards.
dataqual.complete: Electronic Data Complications: All of the magnetic tapes are older then their guaranteed physical lifespan.

cntaddr.address: Institute of Ocean Sciences, P.O. Box 6000, 9860 West Saanich Road

stdorder.nondig: Hardcopy Original Exists: Y Hardcopy Locations: Keith Johnson, Rm 2404, IOS, and 1421 IOS Hardcopy Description: Binders of log sheets from the ships. Hardcopy Volume: about 3 4 in. binders Hardcopy Complications: N/A Physical Sample Exists: Y Physical Sample Locations: C.S. Wong, Cooler in Hangar Bldg, IOS. Physical Sample Volume: 30 samples Physical Sample Description: C-13 seawater samples Physical Sample Complications: Samples need to be kept refrigerated.

digtinfo.formcont: PCO2 data: special in-house programs for gas chromatograph (raw) data.

stdorder.ordering: Electronic Data Doc Locations: Header information in each file Dataset Locations: Shared drive (CHEM), other computer hard drives in chemistry

distinfo.techpreq: Backup by Custodian: Y Backup by Automation: Y Backup Description: Most data are on Alpha/Unix computers. Magnetic tapes (9-track) ascii data files are alsways saved to 3 mirror image tapes. VAX account backup saved to only 1 tape. Most data on tapes are no longer current version. Some magnetic tapes were sent to Vancouver tape archive some years ago.
